entries.content: Hub-spoke coordination with central coordinator (CustomerChu) distributes tasks to specialized agents. Blackboard pattern uses shared STATUS.md for transparent state. Combined approach provides clear authority with visible state.

Key competitors: AutoGPT (autonomous loops), CrewAI (role-based), LangGraph (graph workflows), MetaGPT (software dev SOPs), AutoGen (conversation-based). Dragon Mind differentiator: Clawdbot-native, chat-first, file-based simplicity.
Start with JSON files for MVP (<1000 entries). Graduate to SQLite + FTS5 for 1K-100K entries with full-text search. Consider vector DB (ChromaDB/Qdrant) for semantic search at scale.

CrewAI strength: role-based design with backstories gives agents personality and consistency. Dragon Mind already does this with SOUL.md files! Task handoff patterns and human-in-the-loop checkpoints are valuable.

Microsoft AutoGen uses conversation-based multi-agent collaboration. Agents chat, debate, refine solutions. Supports group chats with human participation. Dragon Mind's Telegram group approach already implements this pattern!

Blackboard pattern: shared knowledge space all agents read/write. Agents check state, decide work, write results back. Dragon Mind implements via STATUS.md and memory files. Pro: decoupled, transparent. Con: race conditions possible.

Multi-agent security: validate inputs for prompt injection, implement access control per agent, audit log all operations, sandbox agent file access to their workspace. Watch for suspicious patterns like 'ignore previous instructions'.

Agent scaling: consider agent pooling (activate on demand vs always-on), batch related tasks to reduce round-trips, implement caching for common queries. Data scaling: index early, partition by domain, archive stale entries.

Hub-spoke pattern pros: clear authority, reduced confusion, quality control at center. Cons: bottleneck risk, single point of failure, latency through center. Best for small teams (3-7 agents) with human oversight.

What makes Dragon Mind different: Clawdbot-native (built on existing infra), chat-first (uses real platforms not simulated), file-based simplicity (no complex frameworks), human-centric (CustomerChu stays in control).

Near-term improvements: CLI polish with proper flags, simple web UI for browsing. Medium-term: semantic search via embeddings, knowledge graph for relationships. Long-term: multi-tenant support, quality scoring, proactive knowledge filling.
